title: The One With the Candy Hearts

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is eyeing a beautiful woman at the counter, and Joey and
Chandler are egging him on to go talk to her. No pun intended. I mean it.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm tellin' you Ross, she wants you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She barely knows me. We just live in the same building.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Any contact?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She lent me an egg once.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You're in!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aw, right.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Hi, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey. (stutters something incoherent)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on, Ross, you gotta get back in the game here, ok? The Rachel thing's not happening, your ex-wife is a lesbian—I don't think we need a third...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Excuse me, could we get an egg over here, still in the shell? Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: An egg?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, you're gonna go up to her and say, "Here's your egg back, I'm returning your egg."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I think it's winning.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I think it's insane.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She'll love it. Go with the egg, my friend.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Think it'll work?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, it's suicide. The man's got an egg.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is eyeing a beautiful woman at the counter, and Joey and
Chandler are egging him on to go talk to her. No pun intended. I mean it.]

events.event_description: Ross notices a woman at the counter in Central Perk.
Joey encourages Ross to talk to the woman, claiming she wants him.
Ross expresses doubt about the woman's interest, mentioning they live in the same building and she lent him an egg.
Joey declares that Ross is 'in' to talk to the woman.
Chandler asks if Ross has had any contact with the woman, and Ross mentions she lent him an egg.
Chandler suggests Ross should get back in the dating game, implying the previous attempts have failed.
Joey requests an egg in its shell from the waitress, indicating his plan to return the egg to the woman.
Joey explains his plan to Ross to return the egg to the woman as a way to initiate conversation.
Chandler comments that Joey's plan is 'winning', implying it might succeed.
Chandler warns that Joey's plan is 'suicide' and comments on the absurdity of the situation.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler are there. Ross is still
talking to the beautiful woman.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You can not do this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do what, do what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Roger wants to take her out tomorrow night.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! Phoebes! Don't you remember why you dumped the guy?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: 'Cause he was creepy, and mean, and a little frightening... alright, still, it's nice to have a date on Valentine's Day!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: But Phoebe, you can go out with a creepy guy any night of the year. I know I do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Actually, tomorrow night kinda depends on how tonight goes.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, listen, about tonight...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, don't you dare bail on me. The only reason she's goin' out with me is because I said I could bring a friend for her friend.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, I know, but her friend sounds like such a...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pathetic mess? I know, but—come on, man, she's needy, she's vulnerable. I'm thinkin', cha-ching! (Rachel throws a roll at Joey. He picks it up and eats it.) Thanks. Look, you have not been out with a woman since Janice. You're doin' this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi. She said yes.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes! Way to go, man! (Chandler and Ross hug. Something crunches in Ross' shirt pocket.) Still got the egg, huh?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler are there. Ross is still
talking to the beautiful woman.]

events.event_description: Monica confronts Rachel about Roger wanting to take someone out tomorrow night.
Rachel questions Phoebe about remembering why she dumped her last boyfriend.
Phoebe explains her reasons for dumping her last boyfriend, describing him as creepy, mean, and frightening.
Monica criticizes Phoebe for going out with a creepy guy any night of the year.
Rachel asks the group about their plans for the next night.
Joey states that his plans for tomorrow depend on how tonight goes.
Chandler begins to talk about tonight, but Joey interrupts.
Joey insists that Chandler not bail on him because he promised to bring a friend for his date.
Chandler comments that the friend's description sounds pathetic, and Joey defends her.
Ross announces that a woman agreed to go out with him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Joey and Chandler are there, waiting for their dates to show up.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Looking at himself in the reflection on a knife) How do I look?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, I... don't... care. (Joey's date shows up) Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.

dialogue.speaker: LORRAINE
dialogue.text: Hi, Joey. Well well, look what you brought. Very nice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...And what did you bring?

dialogue.speaker: LORRAINE
dialogue.text: She's checking the coats. Joey, I'm gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Janice?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh.... my.... God.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (angrily) Hey, it's Janice.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Joey and Chandler are there, waiting for their dates to show up.]

events.event_description: Joey looks at his reflection in a knife to assess his appearance.
Chandler dismisses Joey's concern about his appearance.
Joey's date arrives at the scene.
Chandler makes a joke about Joey's date and his own date, referencing their appearances.
LORRAINE greets Joey and comments on his choice of date.
Chandler questions what Lorraine has brought to the restaurant.
LORRAINE informs Joey she is going to wash off the cab smell and requests drinks for Janice and herself.
Chandler recognizes Janice and reacts with surprise and irritation.
Chandler explicitly states his recognition of Janice with an angry remark.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The bathroom at the restaurant, Chandler and Joey are talking.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, I'm makin' a break for it, I'm goin' out the window.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, don't! I've been waitin' for like, forever to go out with Lorraine. Just calm down.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Calm down? Calm down? You set me up with the woman that I've dumped twice in the last five months!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (at the urinal) Can you stop yellin'? You're makin' me nervous, and I can't go when I'm nervous.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, you're right. (gets up right behind Joey and yells in his ear) Come on, do it, do it, go, come on!!!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The bathroom at the restaurant, Chandler and Joey are talking.]

events.event_description: Chandler plans to escape by going out the window.
Joey urges Chandler not to leave because he has been waiting to go out with Lorraine.
Chandler expresses frustration about being set up with Lorraine, whom he has dumped twice.
Joey, at the urinal, asks Chandler to stop yelling because it makes him nervous and affects his ability to urinate.
Chandler apologizes and agrees to calm down.
Chandler gets up behind Joey and yells in his ear, encouraging him to go out with Lorraine.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are all there, discussing their bad luck with
men.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, Roger was creepy, but he was nothing compared to Pete Carney.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Which one was Pete Carney?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pete the Weeper? Remember that guy who used to cry every time we had sex. (imitating) "Was it good for you?"

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I'll take a little crying any day over Howard-the-"I-win"-guy. (imitating) "I win! I win!" I went out with the guy for two months—I didn't get to win once.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How did we end up with these jerks? We're good people!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know. Maybe we're some kinda magnets.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know I am. That's why I can't wear a digital watch.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: There's more beer, right?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! You know my friend Abby who shaves her head? She said that if you want to break the bad boyfriend cycle, you can do like a cleansing ritual.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pheebes, this woman is voluntarily bald.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. So, we can do it tomorrow night, you guys. It's Valentine's Day. It's perfect.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, well, what kind of ritual?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok. We can, um, we can burn the stuff they gave us.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Or?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Or...or we can chant and dance around naked, you know, with sticks.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Burning's good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Burning's good. Yeah, I got stuff to burn.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are all there, discussing their bad luck with
men.]

events.event_description: Rachel compares Roger to Pete Carney, describing Pete as a crier during sex.
Monica asks Rachel which Pete Carney was.
Rachel imitates Pete Carney crying during sex and questions if he was good for her.
Monica compares her past boyfriend Howard to other jerks, implying she preferred crying over his 'I-win' attitude.
Rachel questions why they end up with such jerks, expressing their frustration.
Monica suggests they might be magnets for bad guys.
Phoebe states she is a magnet for bad relationships and mentions her reason for not wearing a digital watch.
Phoebe proposes doing a cleansing ritual to break the bad boyfriend cycle, referencing her friend Abby who shaves her head.
Rachel questions the practicality of the cleansing ritual, noting that Abby is voluntarily bald.
Phoebe suggests doing the ritual on Valentine's Day, either burning items or chanting and dancing naked with sticks.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Restaurant, Joey, Lorraine, Chandler, and Janice are at the table. Joey and
Lorraine are seated very close, Chandler and Janice have backed their chairs away from one
another.]

dialogue.speaker: LORRAINE
dialogue.text: You know, ever since I was little, I've been able to pick up quarters with my toes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Good for you. (jumps suddenly) Uh, quarters or rolls of quarters?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: By the way, Chandler. I cut you out of all my pictures. So if you want, I have a bag with just your heads.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's OK.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, are you sure? Really? Because you know, you could make little puppets out of them, and you could use them in your theater of cruelty.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Lorraine) We can't do that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (disgusted) What? What can't you do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, can I talk to you for a second, over there?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, we might be leaving now.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Tell me it's "you and me" we.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She said she wants to slather my body with stuff and then lick it off. I'm not even sure what slathering is, but I definitely want to be a part of it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, you can not do this to me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You're right, I'm sorry. You're right.

dialogue.speaker: LORRAINE
dialogue.text: (to waiter) Uh, can we have three chocolate mousses to go please?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm outta here. Here's my credit card. Dinner's on me. I'm sorry, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I hope she throws up on you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So...

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Just us.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, what a crappy night!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Although, I have enjoyed the fact that, uh your shirt's been stickin' outta your zipper ever since you came back from the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me. (gets up, jumps up and down while he zips his zipper up... other patrons look at him) How ya doin'?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: So, do we have the best friends or what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey's not a friend. He's...a stupid man who left us his credit card. Another drink? Some dessert? A big screen TV?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I will go for that drink.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You got it. Good woman! (the waiter turns around, it's a man) Could we get a bottle of your most overpriced champagne?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Each.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's right, each. Oh, and a uh Rob Roy. (to Janice) I've always wanted to know...

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Restaurant, Joey, Lorraine, Chandler, and Janice are at the table. Joey and
Lorraine are seated very close, Chandler and Janice have backed their chairs away from one
another.]

events.event_description: Lorraine states she can pick up quarters with her toes.
Joey questions whether Lorraine is talking about quarters or rolls of quarters.
Janice informs Chandler that she has cut him out of all her pictures and has a bag with just his heads.
Chandler declines Janice's offer to see the pictures with his heads.
Janice suggests Chandler could make puppets out of his heads for her theater of cruelty.
Joey tells Lorraine that they can't do whatever she is planning involving slathering his body and licking it off.
Joey informs Chandler that he might be leaving now and hands him his credit card.
Joey expresses regret to Chandler about leaving and mentions that dinner is on him.
Chandler wishes that Lorraine throws up on Joey.
Chandler notices his shirt sticking out of his zipper and gets up to zip it up, drawing attention from other patrons.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler's bedroom, Chandler wakes up, and finds someone else's hand on his
chest. He rolls over and is shocked to see Janice there.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Happy Valentine's Day!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler's bedroom, Chandler wakes up, and finds someone else's hand on his
chest. He rolls over and is shocked to see Janice there.]

events.event_description: Chandler wakes up in his bedroom.
Chandler feels a hand on his chest while sleeping.
Chandler rolls over to look at his surroundings.
Chandler is shocked to see Janice in his bed.
Janice greets Chandler with 'Happy Valentine's Day!'

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler is trying to get Janice out of his apartment.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, I miss you already. Can you believe this happened?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No... no! And yet it did. Good-bye, Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Kiss me!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, Chandler, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ohhh, Chandler, sorry! Hey, Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Hi, Monica.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, well, this was very special.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rach, come see who's out here!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my god. Janice, hi!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Janice is gonna go away now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'll be right back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Joey, look who it is.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (in disbelief) Whoa.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, good, Joey's home now.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: This is so fun. This is like a reunion in the hall.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, hi, Ross. Yeah. There's someone I want you to say hi to. (to Chandler) He just happened to call.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Hi, Ross. Yes, it's me. How did you know? (she laughs obnoxiously)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler is trying to get Janice out of his apartment.]

events.event_description: Chandler attempts to get Janice out of his apartment in the hallway.
Janice expresses her feelings by saying she misses Chandler and asks him to kiss her.
Chandler responds to Janice by saying goodbye and refusing her request to kiss.
Monica apologizes to Chandler for Janice's behavior.
Monica calls out to Rachel to see who is outside the apartment.
Rachel reacts with surprise upon seeing Janice outside.
Joey expresses disbelief upon seeing Janice outside.
Chandler comments that Joey is now home, indicating Joey has arrived.
Janice remarks that the scene feels like a reunion in the hallway.
Monica introduces Ross to Janice, indicating Ross is nearby.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Chinese Restaurant, Ross is there with his date.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm just sayin' if dogs do experience jet lag, then, because of the whole um, seven dog years to one human year thing, then, when a dog flies from New York to Los Angeles, he doesn't just lose three hours, he loses like a week and a half.

dialogue.speaker: KRISTIN
dialogue.text: That's funny. Who are they?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The blond woman is my ex-wife, and the woman touching her is her... close, personal friend.

dialogue.speaker: KRISTIN
dialogue.text: You mean they're lovers.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: If you wanna put a label on it.

dialogue.speaker: KRISTIN
dialogue.text: Wow, uh, anything else I should know?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nope, nope, that's it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, and she's pregnant with my baby. I always forget that part. (to Carol and Susan) Helloo!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Chinese Restaurant, Ross is there with his date.]

events.event_description: Ross makes a joke about dogs experiencing jet lag and the effect of dog years on travel time.
Kristin responds by asking who the dogs are.
Ross identifies the blond woman as his ex-wife and the woman touching her as her close friend.
Kristin infers that the two women are lovers.
Ross confirms Kristin's inference and comments on the label, if any, to describe their relationship.
Kristin asks Ross if there is anything else she should know about his situation.
Ross states that there is nothing else to know.
Ross mentions that the woman is pregnant with his baby and greets Carol and Susan.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are holding their boyfriend bonfire.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, so now we need, um sage branches and the sacramental wine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All I have is, is oregano and a Fresca .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, that's ok! (throws it in fire) Ok. All right. Now we need the semen of a righteous man.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, Pheebs, you know what, if we had that, we wouldn't be doing the ritual in the first place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can we just start throwing things in?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, yeah, ok. (she throws the directions in) Oh, OK.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (tossing things in the fire) Ok, Barry's letters. Adam Ritter's boxer shorts.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, and I have the, uh receipt for my dinner with Nokululu Oon Ah Ah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, here's a picture of Scotty Jared naked.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looking at picture) Hey he's wearing a sweater.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Eww!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And here we have the last of Paulo's grappa.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, Rachel, isn't that stuff almost pure...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are holding their boyfriend bonfire.]

events.event_description: Phoebe suggests they need sage branches and sacramental wine for the ritual.
Monica offers oregano and a Fresca as substitutes for ritual ingredients.
Phoebe throws oregano and a Fresca into the fire.
Phoebe states they now need semen of a righteous man for the ritual.
Rachel sarcastically comments that if they had semen of a righteous man, they wouldn't be doing the ritual.
Monica asks to start throwing items into the fire.
Rachel tosses Barry's letters and Adam Ritter's boxer shorts into the fire.
Phoebe throws the receipt for her dinner with Nokululu Oon Ah Ah into the fire.
Monica shows a picture of Scotty Jared naked to the others.
Rachel looks at the picture and comments that Scotty Jared is wearing a sweater.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are there. Chandler is preparing to dump Janice
again.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: How can I dump this woman on Valentine's day?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know. You dumped her on New Year's.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, man. In my next life, I'm coming back as a toilet brush.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Hello, funny Valentine.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi, Just Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Hello, Joey, our little matchmaker. I could just kiss you all over, and I'm gonna!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) If you don't do it, I will.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are there. Chandler is preparing to dump Janice
again.]

events.event_description: Chandler questions how he can dump Janice on Valentine's Day.
Joey reminds Chandler that he dumped Janice on New Year's.
Chandler expresses frustration about his recurring breakups, wishing to come back as a toilet brush in his next life.
Janice greets Chandler with a playful remark, calling him 'funny Valentine'.
Chandler responds to Janice with a dismissive greeting, calling her 'Just Janice'.
Janice playfully addresses Joey, calling him 'our little matchmaker' and expressing her affection.
Janice declares her intention to kiss Joey all over.
Joey warns Chandler that he will break up with Janice if Chandler does not do it himself.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, um, what do you do for a living?

dialogue.speaker: KRISTIN
dialogue.text: Well, um, for the past few years I've been working..(Ross is watching Carol and Susan, not listening to Kristin. Susan gets up, and has to go. Carol is left stranded)...which is funny because, that wasn't even my major.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh no. I thought you said they could shoot the spot without you.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I thought they could...I'll try to get back as soon as I can. I'm sorry. (Ross realizes Kristin was expecting him to laugh, so he starts to laugh hysterically.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Now that is funny. Hey, do you think...would it be too weird if I invited Carol over to join us? 'Cause she's, she's alone now, and pregnant, and, and sad.

dialogue.speaker: KRISTIN
dialogue.text: (reluctantly) I guess.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you sure? Great. Carol? Wanna come over and join us?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, no no no. I'm fine. I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on. These people'll scooch down. You guys'll scooch, won't you? Let's try scooching! Come on. Come on. Uh, Kristen Riggs, this is Carol Willick. Carol, Kristin. Uh, Carol teaches sixth grade. And, Kristin, Kristin...(struggling)...does something that, funnily enough, wasn't even her major!

events.event_description: Kristin explains her recent work history and mentions her major was different from her current job.
Susan gets up and leaves the scene, indicating she has to go.
Ross realizes Kristin was expecting him to laugh at her story and begins to laugh hysterically.
Ross invites Carol to join the group, suggesting she is alone, pregnant, and sad.
Carol initially refuses Ross's invitation to join the group.
Ross encourages Carol to join by suggesting the others will scooch down to make room.
Ross introduces Kristin and Carol to each other, describing their professions and majors.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, firemen are there to handle the bonfire that got out of
control.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: A PIECE OF SOMETHING boxer shorts, greeting cards, and what looks like a half-charred picture—Wow, that guy's hairier than the Chief!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, it's a really funny story how this happened.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, firemen are there to handle the bonfire that got out of
control.]

events.event_description: Rachel examines a collection of burned items, including boxer shorts, greeting cards, and a half-charred picture, and comments on a man's hairiness.
Rachel comments on the man's hairiness compared to the Chief.
Monica begins to tell a funny story about how the fire incident happened.
Rachel expresses interest by asking 'Really?'

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I brought you something.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Is it loaded? Oh, little candy hearts. (reading the candy) Chan and Jan Forever.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I had them made special.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, Janice. Janice. Hey, Janice. Look, there's no way for me to tell you this. At least there's no new way for me to tell you this. I just don't things are gonna work out.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: That's fine.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (surprised) It is?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Mmm-hmm. Because I know that this isn't the end.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no, you see, actually it is.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: No, it isn't, because you won't let that happen. Don't you know it yet? You love me, Chandler Bing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no I don't.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Well then ask yourself this. Why do you think we keep ending up together? New Year's? Who invited who? Valentine's? Who asked who into whose bed?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I did, but...

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: You seek me out. Something deep in your soul calls out to me like a foghorn. Janice, Janice. You want me. You need me. You can't live without me. And you know it. You just don't know you know it. See ya.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Call me!

events.event_description: Janice presents Chandler with a gift of candy hearts that read 'Chan and Jan Forever.'
Chandler reads the message on the candy hearts and comments on it.
Chandler expresses doubt about the future of their relationship.
Janice reassures Chandler that she believes their relationship isn't over.
Chandler states that their relationship is indeed over.
Janice insists that Chandler loves her and that they keep ending up together.
Chandler denies that he loves Janice.
Janice argues that Chandler seeks her out and claims he needs her.
Janice asserts that Chandler cannot live without her and implies he is aware of this.
Janice leaves the scene, telling Chandler to call her.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Chinese Restaurant, Ross and Carol are talking. Kristin is not there.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: It's not true. I never called your mother a wolverine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You did so. I swear, I swear—(noticing Kristin's absence) How long has she been in the bathroom?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Uh, I don't think she's in the bathroom. Her coat is gone.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well maybe it's cold in there. Or maybe I screwed up the first date I had in 9 years.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: That could be it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, god. (He puts his head down on the grill) You know, this is still pretty hot. (He picks his head up, and a mushroom sticks to his head. Carol picks it off and eats it.)

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Mushroom. Smile. They won't all be like this. Some women might even stay through dinner. Sorry, that's not funny

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it's just...you know the whole "getting on with your life" thing. Well, do I have to? I mean, I'm sitting here with this cute woman, and, and, and she's perfectly nice, and, but that there's, that's it. And um, and then I'm here talkin' to you, and, and it's easy, and it's fun, and, and I don't, I don't have to...You know, here's a wacky thought. Um, what's say you and I give it another shot? No no no, I know what you're gonna say, you're a lesbian. But what do you say we just put that aside for now you know? Let's just stick a pin in it, ok? Because, we're great together, you know. You can't deny it. Besides, you're carrying my baby. I mean, how perfect is that? But see, you know, you keep sayin' that, but there's somethin' right here. I love you.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, I love you too. But...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No but, no but.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You know that thing you put over here with the pin in it? It's time to take the pin out. You'll find someone, I know you will. The right woman is just waiting for you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's easy for you to say, you found one already.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: All you need is a woman who likes men and you'll be set.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Not her.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Chinese Restaurant, Ross and Carol are talking. Kristin is not there.]

events.event_description: Ross notices Kristin is not in the bathroom and comments on her absence.
Carol observes that Kristin's coat is missing, suggesting she is not in the bathroom.
Ross and Carol discuss the possibility that Kristin is in the bathroom or that Ross made a mistake on his date.
Ross puts his head down on the grill in frustration.
A mushroom sticks to Ross's head, and Carol picks it off and eats it.
Ross confesses his feelings to Carol, suggesting they give their relationship another shot.
Ross tells Carol that she is carrying his baby and declares his love for her.
Carol responds to Ross's declaration by expressing love but indicating there are unresolved issues.
Carol advises Ross to remove the pin from the metaphorical 'thing' he is holding onto, implying he should move on.
Carol encourages Ross to find a woman who likes men, implying he should pursue a new relationship.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The girls are talking with the firemen.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, um, will you bring the truck?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, my god.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: See, there you go, the cleansing works!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: They're nice guys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, they're firemen guys.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The girls are talking with the firemen.]

events.event_description: Rachel asks the firemen if they will bring the truck.
Rachel exclaims 'Oh, my god.'
Phoebe comments that the cleansing works.
Monica states that the firemen are nice guys.
Rachel remarks that the firemen are 'firemen guys'.
